page.shortlink: api client api a5 listbox column object
page.description: Definition of a column in a layout in the list.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the column in the layout.

property.name: header
property.description: Settings for the column header.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML for the column header.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the column header.

property.name: hoverClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the column header when the user mouse over it.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the column header.

property.name: onClick
property.description: Event fired when a column header in the list is clicked.

property.name: onDblClick
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is double clicked.

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is context clicked.

property.name: data
property.description: Settings for the column in each row of the list.

property.name: template
property.description: The template for a column in the row. See *[link:A5.u.template]*.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the column in each row.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the column in each row.

property.name: separator
property.description: Settings for the column separator.

property.name: location
property.description: The location for the column separator. The values can be "none" (the default), "left" or "right".

property.name: width
property.description: The width of the separator. The default is "1px".

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to use on the separator.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to apply to the separator.

property.name: order
property.description: The name of the column in the list data to order on. By default the order on the column will change from "none" to "ascending" to "descending" and back to "none". Adding ":reverse" after the column name will reverse the order to "none" to "descending" to "ascending" and back to "none".

property.name: onBeforeOrder
property.description: Event fired before the column is sorted when the user clicks on the column header.

argument.name: columnObject
argument.description: The object that defines the column to order on (the object that contains this event).

property.name: onOrder
property.description: Event fired when the column is sort by the user clicking on the column header.

argument.name: column
argument.description: The column that was ordered on.

argument.name: columnObject
argument.description: The object that defines the column that was ordered on (the object that contains this event).

property.name: width
property.description: The size of a column in CSS units. Columns can be made flexible so that the total width of all columns equals the width of the list. A flex value is specified by using the text "flex(" followed by a number and a ")". For example: "flex(2)" - which would make a column twice the width of a column with "flex(1)". The default value is "flex(1)".

property.name: resize
property.description: Whether or not the column is resizable by the user. The default value is false.
